body_text.text: Age structure within LiST LiST has a fairly simple age structure within the model that serves as a pseudo cohort. The age periods in LiST include pregnancy, 0-1, 1-5, 6-11, 12-23 and 24-59 months. Within the model impact at one age period has a cascading effect of what happens at the next.
body_text.section: Figure 1. Impact pathways of health interventions reducing risks factors and causes of death in LiST

body_text.text: For pregnancy, neonatal and 1-59 months there is a fixed cause of death structure in the base year (during pregnancy it is period of stillbirths). There is also a mortality rate that is applied to the age period. Within the 1-59 months period it is adjusted to reflect the higher mortality at earlier ages. Interventions within LiST can have an impact on one or more age periods.
body_text.section: Figure 1. Impact pathways of health interventions reducing risks factors and causes of death in LiST
